items.title: Kia’s next EV is the affordable, long-range EV4 sedan
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Kia announces the EV4 sedan and hatchback at the 2025 EV day event in Spain.
- The EV4 boasts a range of up to 630km on a single charge with an 81.4 kWh battery, and accelerates from 0-62 mph in 7.4 seconds.
- The sedan will be built in Korea and launch in March 2025, while the hatchback will be produced in Slovakia for a second half of 2024 release.
- Pricing for the EV4 will start at 37,000 euros (approximately $38,500) with an initial run of 160,000 units, including 80,000 for North America.
- The EV2 small electric SUV concept will follow in 2026, aiming for an even lower price point.

items.title: Meta’s AI chatbot will soon have a standalone app
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Meta is planning to launch a dedicated standalone app for its AI chatbot, aiming to reach users outside its existing platforms such as Facebook and Instagram.
- The app could launch in the second quarter of 2025, contributing to the trend of standalone AI applications.
- The AI chatbot has previously been integrated into Meta's existing applications and now offers features like answering questions, generating images, and providing personalized recommendations using its memory.
- Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has committed to a major investment strategy for AI, amounting to $65 billion, with an AI event scheduled for April 29, 2025.

items.title: Amazon CEO says ‘beautiful’ new Alexa hardware is coming this fall
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Amazon plans to unveil a brand new lineup of devices in the fall that are described as beautiful, according to CEO Andy Jassy.
- The new hardware will support Alexa Plus, an upgraded version of the smart assistant capable of performing more tasks, launching soon at a cost of $19.99 per month or included with Prime subscriptions.
- Amazon is placing greater emphasis on displays with plans for future hardware, as evidenced by the recent launch of a larger 21-inch Echo Show.

items.title: Cricut’s new crafting machines are more accurate, faster, and cheaper
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Cricut unveiled the Cricut Maker 4 and Cricut Explore 4, the first updates in almost four years.
- The machines are faster, more accurate, and cheaper, starting at $249.99 for Explore 4 and $399.99 for Maker 4, available in sage and seashell colors.
- They will be released on February 28, 2025, and include materials for 10 initial projects.
- The new models boast speed improvements, up to twice as fast for thin materials, and a new optical sensor for better cutting accuracy in various lighting conditions.
- The Maker 4 supports over 300 materials, while Explore 4 handles around 100 materials.
- Past controversy arose from proposed subscription fees for design uploads, but those plans were scrapped after backlash.

items.title: Apple will let parents share their kids’ ages to limit app access
The best iPhones
The Best Android Phones
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- The Android ecosystem offers a wider range of devices compared to iPhone.
- AI features on Android are still developing; notable are Pixel's AI tagging and Galaxy's call translation.
- Top Android phones tested provide strength in hardware longevity, high resolution, and smooth refresh rates.
- Recommended features include an IP68 rating for durability and extensive software updates.
- Despite a variety of options in Asia and Europe, US consumers face limited choices, focusing on unlocked phones is advised.
- Key products highlighted include the Google Pixel 9, Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra, and a compact Samsung Galaxy S25.

items.title: Microsoft releases a Copilot app for Mac
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft has launched a native Copilot app for macOS, providing access to its AI assistant.
- Features include a dark mode, a shortcut command (Command + Space), and the ability to upload images and documents for assistance.
- The app will be available in the US, UK, and Canada, and includes document summarization features coming soon.
- Microsoft recently removed usage limits on Copilot Voice and Think Deeper for free users, allowing unlimited interactions with the AI.

items.title: OpenAI announces GPT-4.5, warns it’s not a frontier AI model
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- OpenAI launches GPT-4.5 as a research preview for ChatGPT Pro users.
- The model is designed to improve writing capabilities and world knowledge, but it is not classified as a frontier model.
- GPT-4.5 features improved computational efficiency and is trained using new supervision techniques and traditional methods.
- It exhibits significantly less hallucination compared to previous models and is stated to be a better collaborator.
- Following the Pro release, GPT-4.5 will be available for Plus, Team, Enterprise, and Edu users in subsequent weeks.
- The model is also accessible in Microsoft’s Azure AI Foundry platform.

items.title: Hands-on with Alexa Plus in the smart home
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- The newly announced **Alexa Plus** introduces a more conversational and capable voice assistant for smart homes.
- Alexa Plus features **eight new voices** and improves natural language processing, allowing more intuitive commands.
- Users can create smart home routines using voice alone, simplifying device control without needing specific names.
- The **new Echo Show UI** will launch soon, offering a customizable interface with larger widgets.
- Alexa Plus integrates with **Ring's Smart Video Search** and enhances cooking controls for better recipe management.
- It costs **$19.99 a month** and will be part of Prime membership, with early access starting in late March in the US.

items.title: Sesame is the first voice assistant I’ve ever wanted to talk to more than once
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Sesame's voice assistant, Maya, leaves users wanting more conversation.
- Developed by a team including Oculus co-founder Brendan Iribe.
- Sesame is also creating AI glasses for all-day use with high-quality audio.
- Plans to open source models and support over 20 languages soon.
- A mini white paper on their technology is available on Sesame's website.

items.title: Meta is firing about 20 employees for leaking
The fallout of Meta’s content moderation overhaul
Here’s a new trailer for the ambitious survival game from PUBG’s creator
Jeff Bezos is sending Katy Perry to space
Microsoft pushes ahead with AI in gaming
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft announced its new AI model, Muse, which generates gameplay for Xbox games.
- Muse was trained on the game Bleeding Edge and understands 3D worlds and physics, raising concerns about AI replacing game developers.
- Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella calls Muse a significant advancement, while game developers express fears about job security and the future of human creativity in gaming.
- AI tools are currently used by 49% of developers according to a recent GDC survey, leading to anxiety over layoffs in the industry.
- Microsoft plans to showcase AI advancements at the upcoming GDC, including discussions on AI's role in unlocking opportunities for players and game creators.

items.title: Powerbeats Pro 2 review: the workout buds to beat
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Powerbeats Pro 2 feature active noise canceling, transparency mode, and heart rate monitoring.
- Compact design with a case that's 33% smaller and buds that are 20% lighter.
- Battery life is improved, offering 10 hours on the buds and 45 hours total with the case.
- Priced at $249.99 and retains the IPX4 rating.
- Redesigned ear hooks for better comfort, especially for glasses wearers.
- Sound quality is improved, described as good for workouts but not audiophile-level.
- Heart rate monitoring works with multiple fitness apps but has limitations for iOS users.
- Wireless charging available, case size remains larger compared to competitors.

items.title: WD’s Xbox expansion cards are nearly matching their Black Friday low
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Western Digital’s WD_Black C50 Storage Expansion Card for Xbox is on sale for $109.99 (down from $157.99).
- The 2TB version is priced at $199.98, about $50 off.
- These expansion cards allow users to store and play games directly without data transfer, offering performance close to the console’s built-in storage.
- Feature Microsoft’s Quick Resume for simultaneous gameplay across multiple titles.
- Installation is easy with a plug-and-play design.

items.title: Shinichirō Watanabe’s Lazarus hits Adult Swim in April
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Shinichirō Watanabe’s new anime, *Lazarus*, will premiere on Adult Swim on April 5th.
- The show will have encores on Max starting April 10th.
- *Lazarus* features a narrative about a painkiller that is actually a deadly poison.
- Adult Swim president Michael Ouweleen commended Watanabe’s work on the show, describing it as a mix of great characters and directing.
- Watanabe hinted that *Lazarus* will reflect on the real-world opioid crisis.

items.title: Trump’s first 100 days: all the news affecting the tech industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The article discusses the various impacts of Trump’s administration on the tech industry during his first 100 days in office.
- Significant changes in government policies affecting technological advancements and federal agencies are highlighted, including potential disruptions to Antarctic research due to administrative chaos.
- Elon Musk's involvement and influence is noted, particularly regarding the establishment of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) and his controversial email to federal employees urging productivity.
- Apple is responding to tariff threats with a proposed $500 billion investment in the US, raising questions about the actual novelty of this commitment.
- Legal challenges against the manipulation of climate change references on USDA websites by the Trump administration are outlined, highlighting concerns over transparency and accountability.
- Various appointments and controversies surrounding governmental positions, including Dan Bongino's role as deputy FBI director and the implications of these on public trust in government agencies are examined.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs on China, Canada, and Mexico will take effect March 4th
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- President Trump confirms that 25% tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico and an additional 10% tariff on Chinese imports will take effect on March 4th unless drug imports are stopped.
- Trump cites high levels of drug imports from Mexico and Canada, particularly fentanyl sourced from China.
- The tariffs had previously been paused for a month but are now set to resume as scheduled.
- Companies like Acer warn that the 10% tariff will result in price increases for laptops, and the auto industry expects significant impacts due to these tariffs.

items.title: Starlink poised to takeover $2.4 billion contract to overhaul air traffic control communication
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- The FAA is close to canceling a $2.4 billion contract with Verizon to modernize air traffic control communication and may award it to Starlink.
- Concerns arise about favoritism and conflict of interest as Musk publicly critiques Verizon's system.
- A SpaceX team has been actively assisting the FAA to develop a safer air traffic control system and has recommended awarding the contract to Starlink.

items.title: Roblox is getting faster on Chromebooks
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Roblox is launching an x86 version optimized for Chromebooks, promising up to 2x faster performance.
- Improvements include smoother gameplay and quicker load times, with frame rate increases of 99% for 'Adopt Me!' and 67% for 'Brookhaven RP'.
- Load times are expected to reduce by 54% and 55% for those games, though specific times are not provided.
- Chromebook players receive exclusive in-game items and a special Chrome jetpack for their avatars.

items.title: US tariffs: how Trump’s tax is hitting Big Tech and beyond
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Automakers face significant impact from Trump’s tariffs on Canada, Mexico, and China.
- A 25% tariff is threatened on chips, with higher rates possible in the future.
- Framework, a laptop manufacturing company, states limited impact from tariffs due to Taiwanese production; future pricing considerations are being evaluated.
- Acer announces a 10% increase in laptop prices in the US, attributing this to Trump's 10% tariff on imported goods from China.
- Small businesses are struggling with rising costs due to tariffs, forcing price increases.
- Big Tech companies remain silent about their responses to these tariffs, with ongoing uncertainties about the impact.

items.title: The Powerbeats Pro 2 can’t play music while tracking heart rate on gym equipment
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Powerbeats Pro 2 can connect to gym equipment to track heart rate but cannot play music simultaneously.
- Issue confirmed by Apple following a review by YouTuber DC Rainmaker.
- Heart rate tracking on iOS limited to seven partner apps; Android compatible with any app supporting Bluetooth heart rate trackers.
- Users of Apple Watch will see its heart rate data prioritized over Powerbeats Pro 2's data.
- Heart rate feature found to be unwieldy and not particularly useful for athletes preferring flexibility with peripherals.

items.title: Disney Plus is adding a bite-sized version of ESPN's SportsCenter
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Disney Plus will launch a new show called SC Plus, a bite-sized version of ESPN's SportsCenter, on March 3rd, 2025.
- SC Plus will provide a fast-paced update of the day’s sports highlights, featuring a top 10 format.
- Weekday hosts will be Gary Striewski and Randy Scott, while Hannah Storm and Jay Harris will host on weekends. Each episode will run for about 15 minutes.
- This initiative aims to attract more casual sports fans and continues to merge the content offerings of Disney Plus and ESPN Plus.

items.title: DoorDash will pay $16.8 million to New York delivery workers after misusing their tips
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- DoorDash to pay $16.8 million to New York delivery workers following a settlement with the Attorney General.
- The payment affects approximately 63,000 workers due to misusing customer tips under the 'guaranteed pay' model.
- Workers may receive several thousand dollars, with some receiving up to $14,000.
- Similar settlements occurred with Illinois ($11.3 million) and Washington DC ($2.5 million).
- The misleading model used customer tips to subsidize worker pay while promising guaranteed amounts.
- Complaints highlighted that workers and customers were misled about how tips were allocated.
- Ongoing litigation related to tipping policies from the pandemic period in Chicago.

items.title: Hoto’s 48-in-1 electric screwdriver set hits a record low $70
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Hoto's 48-in-1 Electric Precision Screwdriver set is on sale for $69.99, a $40 discount.
- The set is designed for fine adjustments on small to medium electronics.
- Features 2 torque speeds and includes various screwdriver bits, spudgers, tweezers, and more in a storage case.

items.title: DJI’s autonomous drone-in-a-box can now launch from moving vehicles
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- DJI has introduced the DJI Dock 3, allowing autonomous drone launches from moving vehicles using a new gimbal mount accessory.
- The DJI Dock 3 is compatible with Matrice 4D and 4TD drones, priced at $21,059 and $23,409, respectively.
- Features include a built-in weather station, improved IP56 rating, expanded operational temperature range, and the ability to communicate with drones up to 10 kilometers away, extendable to 25 kilometers.
- The dock requires power and internet access but can be upgraded for remote deployment with a cellular 4G dongle.
- Matrice 4D and 4TD models have advanced flight features, including anti-ice propellers and expanded night capabilities with infrared technology.

items.title: Amazon's New Quantum Computing Chip Aims to Improve Error Correction
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Amazon launches Ocelot, a quantum computing chip designed to enhance error correction efficiency.
- The chip may reduce quantum error correction costs by up to 90% compared to existing methods.
- Amazon’s approach uses 'cat qubits' to intrinsically suppress certain types of errors rather than adding more qubits for correction.

items.title: Five predictions for where crypto is headed in 2025
items.author: Vox Creative
items.summary:
- Crypto market experiences resurgence due to friendlier regulations and rising coin values, with Bitcoin doubling in value last year.
- AI will unlock new possibilities in crypto trading and asset management through DeFi strategies.
- The market is expected to solve fragmentation issues with solutions like Saga's Liquidity Integration Layer, enhancing liquidity across chains.
- Traditional gaming brands are integrating blockchain to improve revenue and player engagement, with support from Saga.
- DeFi infrastructure is maturing within gaming, facilitating cross-platform economies and sustainable models.
- Demand for blockchain space is anticipated to surge due to increased activity and innovations in AI and crypto.

items.title: Understanding Elon Musk’s polarizing ascent in the MAGA movement
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- Elon Musk's relationship with Trump influences right-wing politics in the U.S.
- Musk's notable appearance at CPAC included a bizarre interview where he showcased a chainsaw.
- The Verge's Gaby Del Valle provided insights on MAGA's perception of Musk and tech regulations after his ties with Trump.

items.title: BoldHue review: the best foundation is the one you print
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The BoldHue is a foundation printer that allows for custom shade matching using six cartridges: five for pigments and one for a skincare-based formula.
- The device calculates the perfect foundation shade by taking readings from different areas of the face, providing a lightweight, dewy finish.
- While priced at $295, it offers a potential solution for those struggling to find the right foundation color across a variety of skin tones.
- Findings show the printed foundation has been effective for different skin tones tested, although concerns remain about the reliance on proprietary cartridges.
- The printer could be beneficial for professional makeup artists who need an extensive range of shades without the bulk of traditional foundations.

items.title: Pokémon Legends: Z-A’s starters make their debut in new trailer
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Pokémon Legends: Z-A introduces classic starters Chikorita, Tepig, and Totodile.
- The game features strategic battles that resemble gameplay mechanics from Diablo.
- Set entirely in Lumiose City, it allows catching monsters without battling sometimes by throwing Pokéballs.

items.title: Pokémon Champions gets right to the fights
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary: - To celebrate nearly 30 years of Pikachu, The Pokémon Company held a showcase revealing upcoming games, including Pokémon Champions. - Pokémon Champions is focused on Pokémon battles, allowing players to import Pokémon from Scarlet, Violet, and Pokémon Home. - Certain limitations exist, as not all Pokémon can be used in Champions and those caught in Champions can’t be returned to Home. - The game is likened to online battle simulators and will be available on Nintendo Switch, Android, and iOS.

items.title: Pokémon Presents 2025: all the biggest news and trailers
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The annual Pokémon Presents showcase is scheduled for February 27, 2025, at 9 AM ET.
- Expect major updates for casual games like Pokémon TCG Pocket, Pokémon Sleep, and Pokémon Go.
- Anticipated reveals include Pokémon Legends: Z-A and details on the new Nintendo Switch 2.

items.title: Sony drops PlayStation VR 2 price to $399
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Sony is cutting the price of PlayStation VR 2 headset to $399.99 from $549, effective March 2025.
- Price cuts will also apply in Europe (€449.99), the UK (£399.99), Japan (¥66,980), and other regions.
- The price drop follows reports of unsold inventory and paused PSVR 2 production due to poor sales.
- The price reduction aims to enhance sales and includes compatibility with PCs through a $60 adapter.

items.title: Instagram’s Reels may get its own app
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Instagram is considering launching Reels as a standalone app due to TikTok's uncertain future in the US.
- Discussions were reportedly led by Instagram head Adam Mosseri with staff; plans are part of a Meta initiative known as Project Ray.
- The Reels app may improve content recommendations and offer three-minute-long videos in the US.
- TikTok currently has approximately 170 million US users and faces potential bans, while Instagram recently introduced Edits, a video editing app similar to TikTok's CapCut.
- Uncertainty remains whether Reels would still be part of Instagram if it becomes a separate app, and this would mark Meta's second attempt at a TikTok competitor after Lasso, which was shut down in 2020.

items.title: Xiaomi 15 Ultra is a small update with a big periscope lens
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Xiaomi announced its 15 Ultra flagship phone at a launch event in China, starting at 6,499 yuan (~$893).
- Features a significant upgrade with a 200MP periscope camera designed for low light performance.
- The phone will launch internationally on March 2nd at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, but U.S. availability is unlikely.
- The design includes a large circular camera module inspired by Leica's camera hardware.
- The phone boasts a 4.3x periscopic lens, shorter than the previous model's 5x but with a better sensor and light capture abilities.
- The main camera has a fixed aperture of f/1.63, differing from the variable aperture of the previous model.
- Other camera specs include three 50MP sensors similar to the prior model.
- The device features a Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, a brighter 6.73-inch display, and a 6,000mAh battery with unchanged charging speeds.
- Xiaomi introduced a new Photography Kit with slight enhancements.

items.title: Engwe Mapfour N1 Pro e-bike review: the new ‘premium’
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- Engwe's Mapfour N1 Pro e-bike targets the European market with legal speed limits.
- Priced at €1,899, it includes premium features like GPS/GSM tracking and carbon fiber construction.
- The N1 Pro weighs 20.1kg (44lbs), heavy for its class, and has mixed performance in range tests.
- It features a 250W motor, intuitive pedal-assist, but reports issues like error messages and a faulty rear light.
- Overall, it meets expectations but issues with servicing and maintenance persist, indicating potential longevity concerns.

items.title: iPhone 16E review: Eh, it’s alright
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- The iPhone 16E features FaceTime, a reliable camera, and simplicity, appealing to those who appreciate the iOS experience.
- Priced at $599, it offers updates like a faster processor, a modern camera, but lacks features like MagSafe and an ultrawide camera.
- Apple positions the 16E as its cheapest iPhone yet, but it's still perceived as lacking essential features at its price point, compared to Android alternatives.
- The camera system includes a 48-megapixel main camera but no ultrawide, which limits photography options.
- The device uses Apple's new C1 modem, which reportedly performs well and offers good battery life, described as "the best battery life ever on a 6.1-inch iPhone."
- AI features, branded as Apple Intelligence, are included but currently don't feel significantly impactful in everyday use.

items.title: Mint and pink: a closer look at the backflipping Framework Laptop 12
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The Framework Laptop 12 features a unique mint and pink color scheme, appreciated by the design team.
- It is the first 12-inch convertible notebook by Framework aimed at fixing budget laptops.
- This model is modular and repairable, making it distinct from other budget options on the market.
- Key specifications include a 50Wh battery and easy SSD swaps, aiming for user convenience.
- Design insights were shared by senior industrial designer Esther Yen at a demo event in San Francisco.

items.title: The best robot vacuums
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Robot vacuums have become essential household devices due to lower prices and enhanced technology.
- The article features the best robot vacuums for various needs, including mopping, pet hair, and small spaces.
- The top pick, Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra, priced at $1,799.99, offers advanced features like AI obstacle avoidance and a self-emptying dock.
- Reviews other models like the Roomba j9 Combo Plus, notable for self-filling its mop tank and powerful suction.
- Key specifications include powerful suction, smart mapping capabilities, and user-friendly apps for operation and control.

items.title: Chip race: Microsoft, Meta, Google, and Nvidia battle it out for AI chip supremacy
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Nvidia is set to unveil its next AI chip, Blackwell Ultra, during its GTC keynote on March 18, with plans for launch in the second half of 2025.
- OpenAI aims to finalize its in-house AI chip design within months to begin production, moving away from dependence on Nvidia's chips for model training and operation.
- Intel cancels development of its Falcon Shores AI chip, focusing instead on Jaguar Shores as a system-level solution for data centers.
- China is reportedly opening an antitrust investigation into Nvidia, linked to the company's acquisition of Mellanox and adherence to approval conditions.

items.title: The latest on the WordPress fight over trademarks and open source
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- A lawsuit alleges Automattic must keep WordPress free, with claims of intentional interference by CEO Matt Mullenweg.
- Mullenweg has deactivated accounts of contributors planning a new WordPress fork.
- Automattic is reducing its contributions to the WordPress project amidst tensions with WP Engine.
- A judge ruled in favor of WP Engine by ordering Automattic to restore access to certain WordPress resources.
- WP Engine reported significant customer cancellations after Mullenweg's critical remarks and campaign against them.
- Automattic offered employees a buyout in light of the ongoing WordPress drama, allowing resignations for a payout of nine months' salary.

items.title: The Xbox Wireless Controller is just $39 right now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- The official Xbox Wireless Controller is currently available for $39, close to its all-time low.
- It supports Xbox’s wireless protocol and can be used with PC and mobile devices via Bluetooth or USB-C.
- The controller features a dedicated share button for saving and sharing clips and screenshots, Bluetooth support, and a USB-C charging port.
- It does not include features found in more expensive controllers, such as replaceable parts or back buttons, but maintains an ergonomic design that has influenced many others.
- Uses standard AA batteries or a rechargeable pack that allows for extended playtime without needing to charge the controller directly.

items.title: Living with extreme heat might make you age faster
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- A study published in *Science Advances* suggests that extreme heat exposure may speed up aging, particularly in older adults.
- Participants aged 56 or older showed an increase in biological age by up to 2.48 years due to prolonged heat exposure, comparable to smoking effects.
- Living in areas with high heat index is linked to significant biological aging, with some experiencing up to 14 additional months of aging.
- Researchers urge more studies on resilience factors against heat and highlight the importance of air conditioning access in mitigating health risks.

items.title: Kick off Pokémon Day 2025 with this gorgeous short film
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Pokémon Day has officially started in Japan with the release of a new short film titled *Dragonite and the Special Delivery*.
- The short film, directed by Maho Aoki and produced by CoMix Wave Films, highlights the journey of Hana, a young Paldean postal worker, and her desire to excel in her job.
- The film emphasizes the teamwork between humans and Pokémon in maintaining the postal system, featuring stunning visuals that enhance the representation of various Pokémon, including scenes in Kalos’ Lumiose City.

items.title: An easy to read and interpret title for the article as a string.
items.author: Verge Staff
items.thumbnail: A URL to a thumbnail image for the article as a string. If no thumbnail is available, use null.
items.summary:
- Scuf announced its new wired controller, the Valor Pro, priced at $99.99, available in 15 styles.
- The controller is positioned between other high-end models priced at $169.99 and $219.99.
- Sony’s new ANC earbuds are expected to come in late May with a transparent glass blue option.
- Retro Remake has opened preorders for its PS One FPGA clone, the SuperStation One, with prices starting at $179.99.
- Xbox introduced a transparent red controller called the Pulse Cipher Special Edition for $74.99, available from February 4th.
- Asus announced the world’s first Thunderbolt 5 eGPU, promising significant performance and connectivity improvements.

items.title: Alexa Plus leaves behind Amazon's earliest Echo devices
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Amazon's new AI-powered Alexa Plus will not support many first-generation Echo devices.
- The devices excluded include the first-generation Echo, Echo Dot, Echo Plus, Echo Tap, Echo Spot, and second-generation Echo Show.
- Some early Echo devices will still retain functionality with standard Alexa, allowing basic commands such as controlling lights and checking the weather.
